subject: Ethics
title: ESG Investing Reality Check
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: ESG Investing Reality Check.

hook.text: An ESG fund labeled 'sustainable' held stock in oil companies, weapons makers, and a private prison firm.

buildup.text: ESG investing rates companies on environmental, social, and governance factors to guide ethical investment.

discovery.text: ESG assets hit $35 trillion globally. Investors want profit and purpose. But who defines 'good'?

twist.text: Rating agencies score the same company wildly differently. Tesla is ESG-great or ESG-terrible depending who you ask.

climax.text: Without standardized metrics, ESG risks becoming another form of greenwashingâ€”good labels on murky realities.

punchline.text: Ethical investing is a $35 trillion question with no agreed answer.

quiz.question: What is a major criticism of ESG investing?
options: It always delivers lower returns than traditional investing
Different rating agencies score the same companies inconsistently
No investors are interested in ESG criteria
